news.title: Ghaziabad development body to adopt Gujarat model for land pooling policy
news.para: The money raised from this remaining developed land will be used for local area development, officials said. Local area development entails strengthening the existing infrastructure of a place where fresh development is not possible.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board fixes Rs 200 crore reserve price for five-acre IT Park land
news.para: The CHB has also framed terms and conditions to dispose of the land through e-tender mode. The land is of freehold nature, making the CHB hopeful of a good competition among companies.

news.title: Over 50% directors of Unitech board resigned in last two years
news.para: Hiranandani group founder and MD Niranjan Hiranandani and former NBCC chairman and MD AK Mittal have put in their papers, joining HDFC MD Renu Sud Karnad and former SBI MD B Sriram, who quit a few months ago.

news.title: Indian Bank hikes MCLR by 0.10% across tenors from September 3
news.para: The Asset Liability Management Committee (ALCO) of the bank has reviewed the Benchmark Lending Rates and decided on an upward revision in MCLR and TBLR across various tenors, the lender said in a regulatory filing on Thursday.

news.title: Hong Kong stock exchange asks Evergrande to rule out risks to management integrity after overhaul
news.para: CHINA-PROPERTY/DEBT-EVERGRANDE (UPDATE 1)UPDATE 1-HK bourse asks Evergrande to rule out risks to management integrity after overhaul

news.title: Evergrande winding-up lawsuit in Hong Kong adjourned until September 5
news.para: An investor in Evergrande's Chinese online real estate and automobile marketplace, Fangchebao (FCB), in June had filed a winding-up petition against the developer in Hong Kong as it had not honoured an agreement worth $110 million to repurchase shares the investor bought in FCB.

news.title: Almost 70 Chinese cities report falling home prices in August 2022
news.para: Nearly 70 Chinese cities reported declines in new home prices in August, the most since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the China Index Academy on Thursday, one of China's largest independent real estate research firms.

news.title: Australia's property downturn puts home buyers in double mortgage bind
news.para: And with prices now falling at their fastest pace in four decades, a sharp reversal from the 25% annual price rises seen just a year ago, the durations of those bridging loans are doubling or even quadrupling from their typical three-month span.

news.title: Karnataka says it will take merciless action against properties blocking flow of rainwater
news.para: Chief Minister Bommai said there was waterlogging in many residential layouts because the developers did not build a proper drain. He added that all such blocks would be removed.

news.title: Chandigarh: SC puts freehold conversion ball in home ministry's court
news.para: The UT administration has discussed the issue with the ministry earlier and shared almost all the required documents already.

news.title: Illegal colonies to become thing of past: Punjab housing minister
news.para: ​He directed the Greater Ludhiana Area Development Authority (GLADA) to unleash development works under its jurisdiction on war footing and asked the officials to ensure that residents of all approved colonies get all the amenities.

news.title: Property tax rebate ends in Chandigarh, fines start
news.para: If the defaulters failed to deposit the tax amount, strict actions would be taken against them as per the norms, including the sealing of their buildings.

news.title: Nagpur development body allots 49 quota flats under PMAY to general category
news.para: There were 49 flats meant for poor people from various reservation categories but those were allotted to applicants of general category while 10 tenements were placed in categories other than they were meant for.

news.title: Builders misusing foothill policies to erect buildings in Dehradun: Experts
news.para: After the twin tower demolition in Noida earlier this week, several activists and architects pointed out that Dehradun is also witnessing a growth in high-rise projects built on active seismic zones as the builders are misusing foothill policies, said experts.

news.title: Applications under land pooling policy can be submitted till Sep 30: DDA
news.para: It is based on a public-private partnership towards proactively increasing economic opportunities and housing supply in a time-bound manner, and harnessing private potential through pooling of land parcels, the statement said.
